claim: King Kong (2005 film) was the lead actress's biggest box office role.

supporting.text: Naomi Watts, the lead actress in King Kong (2005), had significant roles in other high-grossing films like The Ring (2002), which may have performed comparably or better in certain markets.

attacks.text: Naomi Watts, the lead actress in King Kong (2005), had significant roles in other high-grossing films like The Ring (2002), which may have performed comparably or better in certain markets.
King Kong (2005) grossed over $550 million worldwide, significantly more than The Ring (2002), which grossed around $249 million globally.
The Ring (2002) had a much higher return on investment (ROI) due to its lower production budget, making it more profitable and impactful for Naomi Watts's career.
Box office success is not solely measured by ROI but also by cultural impact and visibility, where King Kong (2005) far exceeded The Ring (2002).

supporting.text: King Kong (2005) grossed over $550 million worldwide, making it one of the highest-grossing films of Naomi Watts' career, supporting the claim.

attacks.text: King Kong (2005) grossed over $550 million worldwide, making it one of the highest-grossing films of Naomi Watts' career, supporting the claim.
Naomi Watts starred in The Ring (2002), which grossed over $249 million worldwide on a much smaller budget, making it a more profitable and impactful role for her career.
While The Ring was profitable, King Kong's significantly higher box office revenue and global recognition still make it a bigger milestone in Watts' career.
Watts' role in Mulholland Drive (2001) was critically acclaimed and culturally influential, even if it didn't match King Kong's box office, making it a bigger career highlight.
Box office success is a measurable metric for 'biggest role,' while critical acclaim is subjective and doesn't directly support the claim.

supporting.text: Watts' role in Mulholland Drive (2001) was critically acclaimed but not a box office hit, suggesting King Kong (2005) may indeed be her biggest commercial success.

attacks.text: Watts' role in Mulholland Drive (2001) was critically acclaimed but not a box office hit, suggesting King Kong (2005) may indeed be her biggest commercial success.
Naomi Watts starred in The Ring (2002), which grossed over $249 million worldwide, significantly more than King Kong's $218 million.
The Ring's box office success was largely attributed to its horror genre appeal rather than Watts' star power, while King Kong's performance was more actor-driven.
Watts' role in Birdman (2014) was part of a Best Picture-winning film that earned $103 million against a $18 million budget, representing a more significant commercial achievement.
Birdman's commercial success was primarily due to its ensemble cast and director's reputation, with Watts playing a supporting role.

supporting.text: The Impossible (2012), another film starring Naomi Watts, performed well at the box office and may rival King Kong (2005) in terms of financial success, casting doubt on the claim.

attacks.text: The Impossible (2012), another film starring Naomi Watts, performed well at the box office and may rival King Kong (2005) in terms of financial success, casting doubt on the claim.
King Kong (2005) grossed over $550 million worldwide, while The Impossible (2012) grossed around $180 million, making King Kong significantly more financially successful.
The Impossible (2012) had a much smaller budget and was critically acclaimed, which may make its box office performance more impressive relative to its scale.
Box office success is typically measured in absolute terms rather than relative to budget, so King Kong's higher gross still makes it the bigger financial success.
